alert.note: Alert for Somerset (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 7:41PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Somerset and southwestern Wicomico Counties through 830 PM EDT... At 739 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Tylerton, or 19 miles southwest of Princess Anne, moving north at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Tylerton, Deal Island, Widgeon, Oriole, Mount Vernon, Smith Island, Monie and Dames Quarter. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects.
